name: Michelangelo Buonarroti
description: A founder of the High Italian Renaissance style, Michelangelo (di Lodovico Buonarroti Simoni) created some of the most influential works in the history of Western art: the marble statues of David (1504) and The Pietà (ca. 1498-1499), as well as the Sistine Chapel frescos in the Vatican, Rome, depicting Genesis (such as in The Creation of Adam (1510)) and the Last Judgment. As an architect, Michelangelo re-designed the dome of St. Peter’s Basilica in Rome. Whether sculpting, painting, or drawing, he instilled a sense of awe-inspiring wonder or terribilità in his works, capturing the emotional and spiritual intensity in the twisting, muscular bodies of his subjects. Michelangelo himself said, 'I saw the angel and carved until I set him free.'
criticallyAcclaimed: Recognized by major institutions and publications for his significant contributions to Renaissance art and his profound influence on subsequent generations of artists.

recentSoloShows.title: Michelangelo: Divine Draftsman and Designer
recentSoloShows.institution: Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

works.title: The Virgin and Child with Saint John and Angels ('The Manchester Madonna'), ca. 1497
L'Esclave rebelle (The Rebellious Slave), Started in 1513
Study for the Nude Youth over the Prophet Daniel (recto), 1510-1511
The Entombment (or Christ being carried to his Tomb), 1500-1501
The Torment of Saint Anthony, ca. 1487
Lazarus with his right arm held across his chest, draped in a shroud; the upper part of Lazarus's body (upside down), 1518
Tomb of Lorenzo de Medici, Duke of Urbino, with Dawn and Evening, ca. 1525
Figure Studies for the Sistine Ceiling (verso), 1510-1511
Creation of Adam, Sistine Chapel ceiling, 1511-1512
Dying slave, for the tomb of Pope Julius II - Giuliano della Rovere - (1443-1513), 1589
The Lamentation over the Dead Christ, 1540
Studies for the Libyan Sibyl (recto); Studies for the Libyan Sibyl and a small Sketch for a Seated Figure (verso), ca. 1510–1511
Bust of Youth and Caricature Head of an Old Man in Left Profile, ca. 1530

name: Raphael
description: Raphael, known for his clarity of form and ease of composition, was a leading figure of the High Renaissance. His works, including the Vatican Stanza della Segnatura frescoes and the 'School of Athens,' epitomize harmony and balance. Celebrated for his mastery of color and composition, Raphael's influence extended beyond his lifetime, shaping the course of Western art.

highAuctionRecord.title: Portrait of a Young Man with an Apple

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to Renaissance art and his transformative impact on subsequent generations of artists.

name: Vincent van Gogh
description: Vincent van Gogh, a post-Impressionist painter, is known for his bold use of color and expressive brushwork. His works, such as 'Starry Night' and 'Sunflowers,' reflect his emotional turmoil and intense creative energy. Van Gogh's artistry and unique vision continue to captivate and inspire audiences worldwide, making him one of the most recognized and influential artists in history.
criticallyAcclaimed: Highly regarded for his innovative style and profound impact on modern art, van Gogh is celebrated as a pioneer of 20th-century painting.

name: Pablo Picasso
description: Pablo Picasso, a pivotal figure in 20th-century art, co-founded the Cubist movement and reinvented traditional artistic conventions. Known for works like 'Les Demoiselles d'Avignon' and 'Guernica,' Picasso's versatility and experimental spirit marked him as one of the most innovative artists of his time. His influence on modern art remains profound and enduring.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his revolutionary approach to art and his monumental impact on 20th-century aesthetics, Picasso continues to inspire artists and audiences worldwide.

name: Claude Monet
description: Claude Monet, a leading figure of Impressionism, is renowned for his evocative landscapes and studies of light and color. His series such as 'Water Lilies' and 'Haystacks' capture the transient effects of nature with a sense of immediacy and vibrancy. Monet's work revolutionized artistic perceptions of space, light, and atmosphere.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his pioneering role in Impressionism and his profound influence on 20th-century art, Monet's legacy endures as a cornerstone of modern painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Monet and Architecture
recentSoloShows.institution: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.

name: Rembrandt van Rijn
description: Rembrandt van Rijn, a master of the Dutch Golden Age, is celebrated for his innovative use of light and shadow and his profound psychological insight. His portraits, such as 'The Night Watch' and 'Self-Portrait with Two Circles,' reveal his technical mastery and deep empathy for his subjects. Rembrandt's work remains a touchstone of Baroque artistry.

highAuctionRecord.title: Portrait of a Young Man with a Plumed Hat

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his unparalleled skill in capturing human emotion and his enduring influence on the evolution of Western art, Rembrandt's legacy continues to resonate across centuries.

recentSoloShows.title: Rembrandt: Master of Light and Shadow

name: Salvador Dalí
description: Salvador Dalí, a surrealist painter, is known for his eccentric imagery and dreamlike landscapes. His works, such as 'The Persistence of Memory' and 'The Elephants,' challenge perceptions of reality and time, embodying the surrealism movement's fascination with the subconscious mind. Dalí's art continues to provoke and intrigue audiences worldwide.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his contributions to surrealist art and his unique vision, Dalí remains an iconic figure in 20th-century painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Dalí: The Late Works
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: Johannes Vermeer
description: Johannes Vermeer, a master of Dutch Golden Age painting, is celebrated for his intimate and meticulously crafted scenes of domestic life. His works, such as 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' and 'The Milkmaid,' are renowned for their luminous quality and subtle portrayal of light. Vermeer's paintings, though relatively few in number, are cherished for their beauty and technical virtuosity.

highAuctionRecord.title: Young Woman Seated at the Virginals

criticallyAcclaimed: Highly regarded for his exquisite depictions of everyday life and his mastery of light and composition, Vermeer's legacy endures as a testament to the Golden Age of Dutch painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Vermeer and the Masters of Genre Painting
recentSoloShows.institution: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.

name: Henri Matisse
description: Henri Matisse, a leading figure of modern art, is celebrated for his use of color and fluidity of form. His works, such as 'The Dance' and 'Woman with a Hat,' reflect his exploration of pure color and expressive line. Matisse's innovative approach to composition and design continues to influence artists across various disciplines.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his transformative impact on 20th-century art and his pioneering role in Fauvism and modernism, Matisse's legacy resonates as a beacon of artistic innovation.

recentSoloShows.title: Matisse: Radical Invention, 1913-1917
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: Jackson Pollock
description: Jackson Pollock, a key figure in Abstract Expressionism, revolutionized modern art with his unique drip painting technique. His works, such as 'Number 1A, 1948' and 'Blue Poles: Number 11, 1952,' are characterized by their dynamic energy and spontaneous gestural marks. Pollock's contributions to avant-garde art continue to inspire debates and interpretations.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his radical approach to painting and his profound influence on abstract art, Pollock remains a seminal figure in 20th-century American art.

recentSoloShows.title: Pollock: A Retrospective
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: Edgar Degas
description: Edgar Degas, known for his paintings, sculptures, prints, and drawings, is celebrated for his depictions of dancers and everyday scenes. A leading figure of Impressionism, Degas explored movement and light, capturing moments with a sense of spontaneity and elegance. His works, such as 'The Dance Class' and 'L'Absinthe,' reflect his keen observation and technical prowess.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to Impressionism and his innovative approach to composition and subject matter, Degas remains a pivotal figure in the history of art.

name: Paul Cézanne
description: Paul Cézanne, a post-Impressionist painter, is celebrated for his explorations of form, color, and perspective. His works, such as 'Mont Sainte-Victoire' and 'The Card Players,' laid the groundwork for Cubism and modern art. Cézanne's emphasis on geometric shapes and brushwork revolutionized artistic conventions and inspired generations of artists.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his transformative impact on modern art and his pioneering role in the development of 20th-century painting, Cézanne's legacy endures as a cornerstone of artistic innovation.

recentSoloShows.title: Cézanne and the Modern: Masterpieces of European Art from the Pearlman Collection

name: Edvard Munch
description: Edvard Munch, a symbolist painter, is best known for his evocative works such as 'The Scream' and 'Madonna.' His exploration of psychological themes and intense use of color and symbolism marked him as a forerunner of Expressionism. Munch's art continues to resonate for its raw emotion and existential themes.
criticallyAcclaimed: Highly regarded for his profound exploration of human psyche and his pioneering role in modern art movements, Munch remains a pivotal figure in art history.

recentSoloShows.title: Edvard Munch: Between the Clock and the Bed
recentSoloShows.institution: Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

name: Georgia O'Keeffe
description: Georgia O'Keeffe, known for her distinctive style and bold compositions, is celebrated for her paintings of flowers, landscapes, and bones. A pioneer of American modernism, O'Keeffe's works, such as 'Jimson Weed' and 'Black Iris,' capture the essence of the American Southwest with a sense of intimacy and abstraction. Her art continues to inspire for its unique vision and artistic innovation.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for her contributions to American modernism and her pioneering role in abstract art, O'Keeffe's legacy endures as a symbol of female creativity and independence.

recentSoloShows.title: Georgia O'Keeffe and Ansel Adams: Natural Affinities
recentSoloShows.institution: Smithsonian American Art Museum, Washington D.C.

name: Gustav Klimt
description: Gustav Klimt, a symbolist painter, is renowned for his decorative style and iconic portraits. His works, such as 'The Kiss' and 'Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I,' epitomize the Vienna Secession movement with their ornate patterns and allegorical themes. Klimt's artistry continues to captivate for its sensuality and symbolic richness.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his pioneering role in the Vienna Secession and his innovative approach to art and design, Klimt remains a pivotal figure in the history of modernism.

recentSoloShows.title: Klimt and the Women of Vienna's Golden Age

name: Francisco de Goya
description: Francisco Goya, a pioneering Romantic painter, is known for his dramatic and provocative works. His paintings, such as 'The Third of May 1808' and 'Saturn Devouring His Son,' reflect his keen observation of human suffering and political turmoil. Goya's art spans various genres, from portraits to allegorical scenes, showcasing his versatility and bold vision.

highAuctionRecord.title: Portrait of the Duke of Wellington

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his penetrating insight into human nature and his profound impact on Romanticism and modern art, Goya's legacy remains influential across centuries.

name: Caravaggio
description: Caravaggio, born Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio, was a Baroque painter known for his revolutionary approach to art. His works, such as 'The Calling of Saint Matthew' and 'The Conversion of Saint Paul,' are characterized by their dramatic use of light and shadow, creating a sense of realism and emotional intensity. Caravaggio's influence on Baroque painting remains profound and enduring.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his innovative use of chiaroscuro and his profound impact on Baroque art, Caravaggio's legacy endures as a defining figure of the Italian Renaissance.

recentSoloShows.title: Caravaggio and His Followers
recentSoloShows.institution: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

name: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
description: Pierre-Auguste Renoir, a leading figure of Impressionism, is celebrated for his vibrant depictions of modern life and feminine beauty. His works, such as 'Luncheon of the Boating Party' and 'Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette,' capture the joy and spontaneity of everyday scenes with a luminous palette and fluid brushwork. Renoir's art continues to enchant for its sensual charm and artistic innovation.

highAuctionRecord.title: Bal du moulin de la Galette

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to Impressionism and his mastery of color and light, Renoir remains a pivotal figure in the history of modern art.

recentSoloShows.title: Renoir: Father and Son/Painting and Cinema
Renoir and Friends: Luncheon of the Boating Party

name: Andy Warhol
description: Andy Warhol, a leading figure in the Pop Art movement, is celebrated for his iconic portraits and images of consumer culture. His works, such as 'Campbell's Soup Cans' and 'Marilyn Diptych,' challenge traditional notions of art and celebrity. Warhol's use of mass production techniques and bold imagery revolutionized contemporary art and culture.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his exploration of fame, consumerism, and the mass media, Warhol's influence on contemporary art and culture remains pervasive.

recentSoloShows.title: Andy Warhol—From A to B and Back Again
recentSoloShows.institution: Whitney Museum of American Art, New York

name: Frida Kahlo
description: Frida Kahlo, a pioneering Mexican artist, is celebrated for her self-portraits and works inspired by Mexican culture and folklore. Her paintings, such as 'The Two Fridas' and 'Self-Portrait with Thorn Necklace and Hummingbird,' explore themes of identity, pain, and resilience. Kahlo's bold use of color and symbolic imagery continues to inspire audiences worldwide.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for her unique voice and her portrayal of Mexican identity and feminist themes, Kahlo remains an icon of 20th-century art and culture.

recentSoloShows.title: Frida Kahlo: Making Her Self Up

name: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec
description: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, known for his paintings, prints, and posters, captured the bohemian life of late 19th-century Paris. His works, such as 'Moulin Rouge: La Goulue' and 'At the Moulin Rouge,' depict the vibrant nightlife and personalities of Montmartre. Toulouse-Lautrec's distinctive style and portrayal of marginalized communities have made him a seminal figure in the history of modern art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his innovative use of color and composition, as well as his insightful portrayal of Parisian nightlife, Toulouse-Lautrec's legacy continues to influence artists and cultural historians.

recentSoloShows.title: Toulouse-Lautrec and the Stars of Paris
Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec: The Chaplin of Montmartre

name: Titian
description: Titian, born Tiziano Vecellio, was a leading figure of the Venetian Renaissance known for his mastery of color and composition. His works, such as 'Venus of Urbino' and 'Assumption of the Virgin,' exemplify his ability to depict mythological themes and religious subjects with a rich palette and dynamic brushwork. Titian's influence on European art was profound and enduring.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to Renaissance art and his pioneering use of color and brushwork, Titian remains a cornerstone of Italian painting and a source of inspiration for generations of artists.

recentSoloShows.title: Titian and the Renaissance in Venice

name: Sandro Botticelli
description: Sandro Botticelli, a Florentine painter of the Early Renaissance, is celebrated for his graceful and ethereal style. His works, such as 'The Birth of Venus' and 'Primavera,' exemplify his use of mythological themes and allegorical figures. Botticelli's artistry, characterized by delicate lines and harmonious compositions, continues to captivate audiences for its beauty and symbolism.

highAuctionRecord.title: Madonna and Child with Young Saint John the Baptist

criticallyAcclaimed: Highly regarded for his contributions to Renaissance art and his poetic interpretations of classical mythology, Botticelli's legacy endures as a testament to the artistic ideals of his time.

recentSoloShows.title: Botticelli and the Search for the Divine

name: Diego Velázquez
description: Diego Velázquez, a Baroque painter, is renowned for his portraits and his role as court painter to King Philip IV of Spain. His works, such as 'Las Meninas' and 'The Surrender of Breda,' are celebrated for their realism and psychological depth. Velázquez's innovative use of brushwork and composition influenced generations of artists and established him as a master of Spanish painting.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his profound insight into human character and his technical virtuosity, Velázquez remains one of the greatest painters of the Spanish Golden Age and a pivotal figure in European art history.

recentSoloShows.title: Velázquez and the Celebration of Painting: The Golden Age in the Museo del Prado

name: John Singer Sargent
description: John Singer Sargent, an American expatriate painter, is celebrated for his portraits and landscapes. His works, such as 'Madame X' and 'The Daughters of Edward Darley Boit,' showcase his mastery of brushwork and keen observation of light and color. Sargent's portraits of the aristocracy and his evocative landscapes have made him one of the most admired portraitists of his time.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his technical skill and his ability to capture the personality and elegance of his subjects, Sargent remains a pivotal figure in the history of American art.

recentSoloShows.title: Sargent: Portraits of Artists and Friends
recentSoloShows.institution: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

name: Hieronymus Bosch
description: Hieronymus Bosch, a Dutch painter of the Early Netherlandish period, is known for his fantastical and allegorical works. His paintings, such as 'The Garden of Earthly Delights' and 'The Last Judgment,' depict surreal landscapes populated by bizarre creatures and moralistic themes. Bosch's art, with its intricate detail and symbolic complexity, continues to fascinate and perplex viewers.
criticallyAcclaimed: Highly regarded for his imaginative vision and his exploration of sin, redemption, and human folly, Bosch remains an enigmatic figure in the history of art.

name: Marc Chagall
description: Marc Chagall, a Russian-French artist, is celebrated for his dreamlike paintings and stained glass windows. His works, such as 'I and the Village' and 'The Fiddler,' blend elements of folklore, religion, and personal symbolism. Chagall's use of vibrant colors and poetic imagery reflects his unique perspective on love, exile, and Jewish identity.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his lyrical style and his ability to evoke emotion through color and form, Chagall remains one of the most distinctive voices in 20th-century art.

name: Peter Paul Rubens
description: Peter Paul Rubens, a Flemish Baroque painter, is celebrated for his dynamic compositions and dramatic use of color. His works, such as 'The Garden of Love' and 'The Descent from the Cross,' showcase his ability to depict mythological scenes, religious subjects, and portraits with a sense of movement and emotion. Rubens's influence on European art was vast and enduring.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his technical skill and his ability to convey drama and emotion, Rubens remains one of the greatest painters of the Baroque period and a key figure in the history of Flemish art.

recentSoloShows.title: Rubens: The Power of Transformation
recentSoloShows.institution: Royal Museum of Fine Arts, Antwerp

recentSoloShows.title: Rubens and His Legacy: Van Dyck to Cézanne

name: Eugène Delacroix
description: Eugène Delacroix, a leading French Romantic painter, is celebrated for his vibrant use of color and his dramatic compositions. His works, such as 'Liberty Leading the People' and 'The Death of Sardanapalus,' reflect his interest in historical and exotic subjects. Delacroix's expressive brushwork and emotive imagery had a profound impact on the Romantic movement and later generations of artists.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his bold approach to painting and his exploration of passion and political themes, Delacroix remains a pivotal figure in the history of French art and Romanticism.

recentSoloShows.title: Delacroix and the Rise of Modern Art

name: Gustave Courbet
description: Gustave Courbet, a French Realist painter, is celebrated for his bold rejection of academic conventions and his focus on everyday life. His works, such as 'The Stone Breakers' and 'A Burial at Ornans,' challenge traditional notions of beauty and subject matter. Courbet's commitment to portraying reality with honesty and sincerity marked a turning point in the history of modern art.

highAuctionRecord.title: L'Atelier du peintre: Allégorie réelle déterminant une phase de sept années de ma vie artistique et morale

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his pioneering approach to realism and his influence on the development of modern art, Courbet remains a key figure in the history of 19th-century French painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Gustave Courbet: A New Vision
recentSoloShows.institution: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

name: Édouard Manet
description: Édouard Manet, a pivotal figure in the transition from Realism to Impressionism, is known for his innovative style and provocative subject matter. His works, such as 'Olympia' and 'Le Déjeuner sur l'herbe,' challenged academic conventions and sparked controversy in the art world. Manet's bold use of brushwork and composition had a profound impact on modern art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his role in shaping modern art and his influence on subsequent movements, Manet remains a seminal figure in the history of French painting.

name: Georges Seurat
description: Georges Seurat, a Post-Impressionist painter, is renowned for developing the technique of Pointillism. His masterpiece 'A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte' exemplifies his meticulous approach to color and light. Seurat's scientific approach to painting and his exploration of optics influenced the development of modern art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his innovative use of color and his contributions to the theory of art, Seurat remains a key figure in the history of 19th-century painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Georges Seurat: The Drawings
recentSoloShows.institution: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

name: Paul Gauguin
description: Paul Gauguin, a Post-Impressionist painter, is known for his bold use of color and his exploration of exotic subjects. His works, such as 'Tahitian Women on the Beach' and 'Where Do We Come From? What Are We? Where Are We Going?,' reflect his quest for authenticity and spiritual meaning. Gauguin's art, with its vivid palette and simplified forms, inspired the Symbolist and Fauvist movements.

highAuctionRecord.title: Nafea Faa Ipoipo (When Will You Marry?)

criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his contributions to modern art and his exploration of cultural identity, Gauguin remains a controversial and influential figure in art history.

recentSoloShows.title: Gauguin: Metamorphoses
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: Amedeo Modigliani
description: Amedeo Modigliani, known for his distinctive portraits and sculptures, is celebrated for his elongated figures and emotive expressions. His works, such as 'Reclining Nude' and 'Portrait of Jeanne Hébuterne,' capture a sense of melancholy and grace. Modigliani's style, influenced by African and ancient art, contributed to the development of modernism in the early 20th century.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his innovative approach to portraiture and his exploration of form and emotion, Modigliani remains a beloved figure in the history of modern art.

name: Camille Pissarro
description: Camille Pissarro, a key figure in Impressionism and Post-Impressionism, is known for his landscapes and urban scenes. His works, such as 'The Boulevard Montmartre at Night' and 'The Côte des Bœufs at L'Hermitage,' capture the changing effects of light and atmosphere. Pissarro's dedication to plein air painting and his role as a mentor influenced artists such as Cézanne and Gauguin.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his contributions to Impressionism and his commitment to capturing the essence of nature, Pissarro remains a central figure in the development of modern art.

recentSoloShows.title: Pissarro's People
recentSoloShows.institution: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco

recentSoloShows.title: Camille Pissarro: Impressions of City and Country

name: Joan Miró
description: Joan Miró, a Catalan painter, sculptor, and ceramicist, is known for his Surrealist and abstract works. His paintings, such as 'The Tilled Field' and 'The Birth of the World,' are characterized by biomorphic shapes and vibrant colors. Miró's playful approach to art and his exploration of the subconscious have had a lasting impact on modern art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his inventive use of symbols and his ability to evoke a sense of wonder, Miró remains one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

recentSoloShows.title: Miró: The Experience of Seeing
recentSoloShows.institution: Louisiana Museum of Modern Art, Denmark

name: Willem de Kooning
description: Willem de Kooning, a Dutch-American abstract expressionist painter, is known for his dynamic and gestural style. His works, such as 'Woman I' and 'Excavation,' explore themes of sexuality, identity, and the human condition. De Kooning's bold use of color and brushwork challenged traditional notions of art and influenced the New York School of painters.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to abstract expressionism and his exploration of the human figure, de Kooning remains a central figure in 20th-century American art.

recentSoloShows.title: Willem de Kooning: The Late Paintings, the 1980s
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: Balthus
description: Balthus, a Polish-French painter, is known for his enigmatic and provocative paintings. His works, such as 'The Street' and 'The Room,' often feature adolescent figures in ambiguous and unsettling settings. Balthus's meticulous technique and psychological depth have made him a controversial yet influential figure in 20th-century art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Acclaimed for his mastery of composition and his exploration of the subconscious, Balthus remains a captivating and polarizing artist in the history of modern painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Balthus: Cats and Girls
recentSoloShows.institution: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York

recentSoloShows.title: Balthus: A Retrospective
recentSoloShows.institution: Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris

name: Jean-Michel Basquiat
description: Jean-Michel Basquiat, an American artist of Haitian and Puerto Rican descent, emerged as a leading figure in the New York City art scene of the 1980s. His works, such as 'Untitled' and 'Irony of Negro Policeman,' blend graffiti with painting and express themes of race, identity, and social commentary. Basquiat's raw energy and expressive style continue to resonate with audiences worldwide.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his fusion of street art and fine art and his exploration of African-American identity, Basquiat remains a seminal figure in contemporary art.

name: Giotto di Bondone
description: Giotto di Bondone, an Italian painter and architect, is considered one of the pioneers of the Renaissance art movement. His frescoes, such as those in the Scrovegni Chapel in Padua and the Basilica of Saint Francis of Assisi, marked a significant departure from the Byzantine style of painting. Giotto's emphasis on naturalism and three-dimensional space had a profound impact on the development of Western art.

highAuctionRecord.title: Scenes from the Life of Christ

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his role in reviving classical ideals and his influence on the Italian Renaissance, Giotto remains a pivotal figure in the history of art.

recentSoloShows.title: Giotto and His Legacy
recentSoloShows.institution: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.

name: Paul Klee
description: Paul Klee, a Swiss-German painter, is known for his unique style that blends abstraction, cubism, and surrealism. His works, such as 'Senecio' and 'Castle and Sun,' explore color theory and geometric forms. Klee's playful and poetic approach to art influenced generations of artists and remains highly influential in modern art.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his innovative use of color and form, Klee is regarded as one of the pioneers of abstract art and a key figure in the Bauhaus movement.

recentSoloShows.title: Paul Klee: Bauhaus Master
recentSoloShows.institution: Whitney Museum of American Art, New York

name: Max Ernst
description: Max Ernst, a German-French painter and sculptor, is known for his surrealistic and Dadaist works. His paintings, such as 'The Elephant Celebes' and 'Europe After the Rain,' explore the subconscious and dreamlike imagery. Ernst's innovative techniques, such as frottage and grattage, pushed the boundaries of traditional art forms.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his contributions to surrealism and his experimentation with artistic techniques, Ernst remains a significant figure in 20th-century art.

recentSoloShows.title: Max Ernst: Beyond Painting
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

recentSoloShows.title: Max Ernst: An Invitation to Look at the Landscapes

name: Mark Rothko
description: Mark Rothko, an American abstract expressionist painter, is known for his large-scale color field paintings. His works, such as 'No. 14' and 'Untitled (Black on Grey),' evoke spiritual and emotional responses through the use of simplified forms and vibrant colors. Rothko's exploration of color and form continues to inspire contemplation and introspection.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his contribution to abstract expressionism and his mastery of color, Rothko remains one of the most influential painters of the 20th century.

recentSoloShows.title: Mark Rothko: The Decisive Decade 1940-1950
recentSoloShows.institution: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.

name: Piet Mondrian
description: Piet Mondrian, a Dutch painter and theoretician, is known for his abstract geometric paintings characterized by grids of black lines and primary colors. His works, such as 'Composition II in Red, Blue, and Yellow' and 'Broadway Boogie Woogie,' embody his vision of universal harmony and balance. Mondrian's style, known as neoplasticism, has had a profound influence on modern art and design.

highAuctionRecord.title: Composition No. III with Red, Blue, Yellow, and Black

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his pioneering role in abstract art and his pursuit of visual purity, Mondrian remains a seminal figure in the development of modernism.

recentSoloShows.title: Mondrian and De Stijl
recentSoloShows.institution: Museum of Modern Art, New York

name: René Magritte
description: René Magritte, a Belgian surrealist artist, is known for his thought-provoking paintings that challenge the viewer's perception of reality. His works, such as 'The Son of Man' and 'The Treachery of Images,' explore themes of identity, language, and representation. Magritte's use of juxtaposition and visual puns continues to fascinate and influence artists and audiences alike.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his surrealistic imagery and philosophical approach to art, Magritte remains one of the most renowned figures in 20th-century painting.

recentSoloShows.title: Magritte: The Mystery of the Ordinary, 1926-1938
René Magritte: The Fifth Season
recentSoloShows.institution: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art

name: David Hockney
description: David Hockney, a British painter, printmaker, and stage designer, is known for his vibrant and colorful works depicting landscapes, portraits, and pool scenes. His paintings, such as 'A Bigger Splash' and 'Portrait of an Artist (Pool with Two Figures),' capture a sense of space and light with a playful use of perspective. Hockney's exploration of technology in art, such as iPad drawings, reflects his ongoing experimentation and innovation.

highAuctionRecord.title: Portrait of an Artist (Pool with Two Figures)

criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his versatility and pioneering spirit, Hockney remains one of the most influential British artists of the 20th and 21st centuries.

name: Edward Hopper
description: Edward Hopper, an American realist painter, is known for his iconic representations of modern American life. His works, such as 'Nighthawks' and 'Morning Sun,' capture moments of quietude and introspection in urban and rural settings. Hopper's use of light and shadow and his ability to evoke mood have made him one of the most recognizable and influential American artists of the 20th century.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for his evocative portrayals of modern life and his mastery of atmosphere, Hopper remains a defining figure in American realism.

recentSoloShows.title: Edward Hopper and the American Hotel
Edward Hopper: A Fresh Look on Landscape

name: Francis Bacon
description: Francis Bacon, a British-Irish painter, is known for his emotionally charged and raw imagery. His paintings, such as 'Three Studies for Figures at the Base of a Crucifixion' and 'Study after Velázquez's Portrait of Pope Innocent X,' explore themes of existential angst and human frailty. Bacon's bold use of color and distorted forms have made him one of the most important painters of the 20th century.
criticallyAcclaimed: Renowned for his visceral and provocative approach to figurative painting, Bacon remains a towering figure in contemporary art.

name: Yayoi Kusama
description: Yayoi Kusama, a Japanese contemporary artist, is known for her avant-garde sculptures, installations, and paintings. Her works, such as 'Infinity Mirrored Room' and 'Polka Dot Pumpkin,' explore themes of infinity, pattern, and obsession. Kusama's distinctive style and exploration of the psyche have made her one of the most celebrated and influential artists of the 21st century.
criticallyAcclaimed: Celebrated for her innovative use of form and her role in the avant-garde art movement, Kusama's work continues to captivate and inspire audiences globally.

recentSoloShows.title: Yayoi Kusama: Infinity Mirrors
recentSoloShows.institution: Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden, Washington D.C.
